meanings.definition: Not guilty of a crime or offense.
meanings.sent1: The young child was innocent of any wrongdoing.
meanings.sent2: She believed in the innocence of her friend despite the accusations.
meanings.sent3: The puppy's innocent eyes made everyone smile.
meanings.sent4: The clear blue sky looked innocent after the storm passed.
meanings.sent5: His innocent laughter filled the room with joy.

meanings.definition: Free from moral wrong; without sin.
meanings.sent1: The kind old man had an innocent heart.
meanings.sent2: She felt pure and innocent after confessing her mistake.
meanings.sent3: The innocent act of sharing cookies brought happiness to all.
meanings.sent4: The innocent beauty of the untouched forest was breathtaking.
meanings.sent5: His innocent smile warmed the hearts of those around him.

meanings.sent1: The innocent child believed in fairy tales.
meanings.sent2: She was too innocent to understand the complexities of the situation.
meanings.sent3: His innocent question about the moon made everyone chuckle.
meanings.sent4: The innocent traveler got lost in the unfamiliar city.
meanings.sent5: Her innocent trust in strangers worried her parents.

meanings.sent1: The innocent puppy played gently with the toy.
meanings.sent2: The flowers in the garden looked innocent and peaceful.
meanings.sent3: The innocent breeze carried the scent of fresh flowers.
meanings.sent4: The innocent raindrops fell softly on the window pane.
